column4: - I would guess that sudo apt-get remove automatix should work if you installed it with a deb file, but I could be wrong
i tried that but it won't. i still get the same segmentation fault then core dumped
- if I were you, I'd do that since it only takes about twenty minutes or so....you can back up your home directory first, of course
i'll just do it since i dont have something to backup anyway.
